content: [Day 1] Inventory Management deploy the room machine. go to http://machineip:3000/ then it will redirect you to login page. login page"login page register a new user account and login with it. credidentials i used: username: fakeuserrohit password: fakepasswordrohit now you see a home page like this. home page"home page
title: Advent of Cyber 1 [2019] - TryHackMe

content: what is the name of the cookie used for authentication? Open devtools>storage>cookies cookies"cookies Answerauthid
title: Advent of Cyber 1 [2019] - TryHackMe

content: if you decode the cookie, what is the value of the fixed part of the cookie? Notecookie is encoded with base64 echo "base64encodedstring" | base64 -d ┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~] └─$ echo "ZmFrZXVzZXJyb2hpdHY0ZXI5bGwxIXNz" | base64 -d fakeuserrohitv4er9ll1!ss cookie format is: username+fixedpart Answerv4er9ll1!ss
title: Advent of Cyber 1 [2019] - TryHackMe

content: after accessing his account, what did the user mcinventory request? to find the answer to this question we need to encode mcinventory username with the fixed part of the cookie. ┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~] └─$ echo -n "mcinventoryv4er9ll1!ss" | base64 bWNpbnZlbnRvcnl2NGVyOWxsMSFzcw== set cookie to bWNpbnZlbnRvcnl2NGVyOWxsMSFzcw and refresh the page inventory page"inventory page Answerfirewall
title: Advent of Cyber 1 [2019] - TryHackMe

content: [Day 2] Arctic Forum deploy the room machine. go to http://machineip:3000/ then it will redirect you to login page. login page"login page there is no link to register a new user account. bruit force is not useful here.

title: Advent of Cyber 1 [2019] - TryHackMe

content: Room Link: https://tryhackme.com/room/crackthehash Room Difficulty: Easy There are two ways to crack the hash. Online cracking (https://crackstation.net) Offline cracking (hashcat) first of all, we need to know the hash algorithm. to know the hash algorithm, I use Name-That-Hash. to install you need to run the following command: apt install -y name-that-hash usage: nth --text "hash"
title: Crack the hash - TryHackMe

content: Challenge 1 48bb6e862e54f2a795ffc4e541caed4d we can find the hash type by running: nth --text "48bb6e862e54f2a795ffc4e541caed4d" name-that-hash result"name-that-hash result we can easily tell this is a md5 hash. because the string length is 32. crackstation is a good to use here. we can easily crack this by using crackstation.net crackstation result"crackstation result Answer of Level 1 Challenge 1easy
title: Crack the hash - TryHackMe

content: challenge 2 name-that-hash result"name-that-hash result we can solve SHA-1 by using https://crackstation.net. CBFDAC6008F9CAB4083784CBD1874F76618D2A97 crackstation result"crackstation result Answer of Level 1 Challenge 2password123
title: Crack the hash - TryHackMe

content: challenge 3 1C8BFE8F801D79745C4631D09FFF36C82AA37FC4CCE4FC946683D7B336B63032 name-that-hash result"name-that-hash result we can solve SHA-256 by using https://crackstation.net. crackstation result"crackstation result Answer of Level 1 Challenge 3letmein
title: Crack the hash - TryHackMe

content: challenge 4 $2y$12$Dwt1BZj6pcyc3Dy1FWZ5ieeUznr71EeNkJkUlypTsgbX1H68wsRom name-that-hash result"name-that-hash result We cannot solve bcrypt hashes with online cracking tools. We need to use offline cracking tools. I use hashcat because it uses gpu to crack the hashes faster. hashcat -m 3200 hash.txt /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt WarningDon’t try to crack this hash. Because bcrypt hash is hard to calculate. It took me Three hours with GTX 1650 GPU. Answer of Level 1 Challenge 4bleh
title: Crack the hash - TryHackMe
